conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on both the wooden block P and the long wooden board ab.
The weight of the block P is mg.
The normal force from the board ab on the block P is N_P.
The kinetic frictional force between the block P and the board ab is f_{kP}.
Since the block P is sliding with constant velocity, the net force on the block in the horizontal direction must be zero.
The kinetic frictional force f_{kP} must balance the force causing the block to slide.
The kinetic frictional force f_{kP} is given by f_{kP} = μ_2 N_P.
Since the block is on a horizontal surface, the normal force N_P is equal to the weight of the block: N_P = mg.
The kinetic frictional force is f_{kP} = μ_2 mg.
The weight of the board ab is Mg.
The normal force from the ground on the board ab is N_{ab}.
The kinetic frictional force between the block P and the board ab is f_{kP} (acting on the board in the opposite direction to the motion of the block).
The kinetic frictional force between the board ab and the ground is f_{kab}.
Since the board ab is stationary, the net force on the board in the horizontal direction must be zero.
The kinetic frictional force f_{kab} between the board and the ground must balance the kinetic frictional force f_{kP} between the block and the board.
The kinetic frictional force f_{kab} is given by f_{kab} = μ_1 N_{ab}.
The normal force N_{ab} is the sum of the weights of the block and the board: N_{ab} = (M + m)g.
The kinetic frictional force is f_{kab} = μ_1 (M + m)g.
Since the board is stationary, f_{kab} must be equal to f_{kP}.
Equate the forces: μ_1 (M + m)g = μ_2 mg.
Solving for f_{kab}: f_{kab} = μ_2 mg.
